title: 113_s2388
content: The "Energy-Efficient Cool Roof Jobs Act" may be cited as the short title. Depreciation recovery period for certain roof systems is addressed in the Act. The "Energy-Efficient Cool Roof Jobs Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code to include a 20-year recovery period for certain roof systems, specifically for initial clearing and grading land improvements related to electric utility transmission and distribution plants, as well as qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property. The "Energy-Efficient Cool Roof Jobs Act" defines qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property as a roof system placed above conditioned or semi-heated space on a commercial building with a slope of 2:12 or less, replacing an existing roof system and meeting insulation requirements from ASHRAE Standard 189.1-2011. The Energy-Efficient Cool Roof Jobs Act specifies that eligible commercial buildings in certain climate zones must have a cool roof surface with specific solar reflectance and thermal emittance values. The CRRC-1 Product Rating Program determines if a roof system meets specific solar reflectance index requirements. The curr_chunk discusses a system of roof components designed to weather-proof and improve thermal resistance of a building. It defines an eligible commercial building and its criteria for qualification. The curr_chunk discusses the eligibility criteria for a qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It includes definitions such as ASHRAE and requirements to use the straight-line method for depreciation. The curr_chunk amends the depreciation rules for qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for real estate investment trusts. The curr_chunk amends the depreciation rules for qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for real estate investment trusts. The amendments include changes to the recovery period to 20 years under the alternative depreciation method. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 312(k)(3) of the Code. These amendments apply to property placed in service after the enactment of the Act.
